justification: The article states that "direct measures of visual attention have recently been used" and describes collecting gaze data with Tobii and EyeLink eye-trackers to capture where participants look.

measured_by: fixation on target attribute within eye-tracking AOI
justification: Trials were classified as overt when "the target attribute was fixated on" according to eye-tracking areas of interest, making fixation the operational measure of overt attention.

measured_by: choice of target option when target attribute not fixated (absence-of-fixation metric)
justification: Covert attention was inferred from "choices of the target option when the target attribute was not fixated on" (S1 trials), using eye-tracking data to detect the lack of fixation.
The study analyses "participants' response times (RTs)… with trials lasting on average 7.04 seconds," using RT as the quantitative measure of decision speed.
